   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Test encode/decode of dictionary-related modules. Each test case
   23: %% runs multiple tests in parallel since many of the tests are just
   24: %% the same code with different in-data: implementing each test as a
   25: %% single testcase would make for much duplication with ct's current
   26: %% requirement of one function per testcase.
   27: %%
   28: 
   29: -module(diameter_codec_SUITE).
   30: 
   31: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   32: -export([run/0,
   33:          run/1]).
   34: 
   35: %% common_test wrapping
   36: -export([
   37:          %% Framework functions
   38:          suite/0,
   39:          all/0,
   40:          init_per_suite/1,
   41:          end_per_suite/1,
   42:          init_per_testcase/2,
   43:          end_per_testcase/2,
   44: 
   45:          %% The test cases
   46:          base/1,
   47:          gen/1,
   48:          lib/1,
   49:          unknown/1,
   50:          recode/1
   51:         ]).
   52: 
   53: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   54: 
   55: -include("diameter_util.hrl").
   56: 
   57: 
   58: -define(CL(F),    ?CL(F, [])).
   59: -define(CL(F, A), ?LOG("DCS", F, A)).
   60: -define(L,        atom_to_list).
   61: 
   62: 
   63: %% ===========================================================================
   64: 
   65: suite() ->
   66:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 15}}].
   67: 
   68: all() ->
   69:     [base, gen, lib, unknown, recode].
   70: 
   71: 
   72: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   73:     ?DUTIL:init_per_suite(Config).
   74: 
   75: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   76:     ?DUTIL:end_per_suite(Config).
   77: 
   78: 
   79: %% This test case can take a *long* time, so if the machine is too slow, skip
   80: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   81:     ?CL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> check factor", [Case]),
   82:     Key = dia_factor,
   83:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
   84:         {value, {Key, Factor}} when (Factor > 10) ->
   85:             ?CL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> Too slow (~w) => SKIP",
   86:                 [Case, Factor]),
   87:             {skip, {machine_too_slow, Factor}};
   88:         _ ->
   89:             ?CL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> run test", [Case]),
   90:             Config
   91:     end;
   92: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
   93:     ?CL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry", [Case]),
   94:     Config.
   95: 
   96: 
   97: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   98:     ?CL("end_per_testcase(~w) -> entry", [Case]),
   99:     Config.
  100: 
  101: 
  102: %% ===========================================================================
  103: 
  104: base(_Config) ->
  105:     ?CL("~w -> entry", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  106:     Res = run(base),
  107:     ?CL("~w -> done when"
  108:         "~n   Res: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Res]),
  109:     Res.
  110: 
  111: gen(_Config) ->
  112:     ?CL("~w -> entry", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  113:     Res = run(gen),
  114:     ?CL("~w -> done when"
  115:         "~n   Res: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Res]),
  116:     Res.
  117: 
  118: lib(_Config) ->
  119:     ?CL("~w -> entry", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  120:     Res = run(lib),
  121:     ?CL("~w -> done when"
  122:         "~n   Res: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Res]),
  123:     Res.
  124: 
  125: unknown(Config) ->
  126:     ?CL("~w -> entry", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  127:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  128:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  129:     Res  = unknown(Priv, Data),
  130:     ?CL("~w -> done when"
  131:         "~n   Res: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Res]),
  132:     Res.
  133: 
  134: recode(_Config) ->
  135:     ?CL("~w -> entry", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  136:     Res = run(recode),
  137:     ?CL("~w -> done when"
  138:         "~n   Res: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Res]),
  139:     Res.
  140: 
  141: 
  142: %% ===========================================================================
  143: 
  144: %% run/0
  145: 
  146: run() ->
  147:     run(all()).
  148: 
  149: %% run/1
  150: 
  151: run(base) ->
  152:     diameter_codec_test:base();
  153: 
  154: run(gen) ->
  155:     [{application, diameter, App}] = diameter_util:consult(diameter, app),
  156:     {modules, Ms} = lists:keyfind(modules, 1, App),
  157:     [_|_] = Gs = lists:filter(fun(M) ->
  158:                                       lists:prefix("diameter_gen_", ?L(M))
  159:                               end,
  160:                               Ms),
  161:     lists:foreach(fun diameter_codec_test:gen/1, Gs);
  162: 
  163: run(lib) ->
  164:     diameter_codec_test:lib();
  165: 
  166: %% Have a separate AVP dictionary just to exercise more code.
  167: run(unknown) ->
  168:     PD = ?MKTEMP("diameter_codec"),
  169:     DD = filename:join([code:lib_dir(diameter),
  170:                         "test",
  171:                         "diameter_codec_SUITE_data"]),
  172:     try
  173:         unknown(PD, DD)
  174:     after
  175:         file:del_dir_r(PD)
  176:     end;
  177: 
  178: run(success) ->
  179:     success();
  180: 
  181: run(grouped_error) ->
  182:     grouped_error();
  183: 
  184: run(failed_error) ->
  185:     failed_error();
  186: 
  187: run(recode) ->
  188:     ok = diameter:start(),
  189:     try
  190:         ?RUN([{?MODULE, run, [F]} || F  <- [success,
  191:                                             grouped_error,
  192:                                             failed_error]])
  193:     after
  194:         ok = diameter:stop()
  195:     end;
  196: 
  197: run(List) ->
  198:     ?RUN([{{?MODULE, run, [F]}, 10000} || F <- List]).
  199: 
  200: 
  201: %% ===========================================================================
  202: 
  203: unknown(Priv, Data) ->
  204:     ?CL("~w -> entry with"
  205:         "~n   Priv dir: ~p"
  206:         "~n   Data dir: ~p"
  207:         "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Priv, Data]),
  208:     ok = make(Data, "recv.dia", Priv),
  209:     ok = make(Data, "avps.dia", Priv),
  210:     {ok, _, _} = compile(Priv, "diameter_test_avps.erl"),
  211:     ok = make(Data, "send.dia", Priv),
  212:     {ok, _, _} = compile(Priv, "diameter_test_send.erl"),
  213:     {ok, _, _} = compile(Priv, "diameter_test_recv.erl"),
  214:     {ok, _, _} = compile(Priv,
  215:                          filename:join([Data, "diameter_test_unknown.erl"]),
  216:                          [{i, Priv}]),
  217:     diameter_test_unknown:run().
  218: 
  219: make(Dir, File, Out) ->
  220:     ?CL("~w -> entry with"
  221:         "~n   File: ~p"
  222:         "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, File]),
  223:     diameter_make:codec(filename:join(Dir, File), [{outdir, Out}]).
  224: 
  225: compile(Dir, File) ->
  226:     compile(Dir, File, []).
  227: 
  228: compile(Dir, File, Opts) ->
  229:     ?CL("~w -> entry with"
  230:         "~n   File: ~p"
  231:         "~n   Opts: ~p"
  232:         "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, File, Opts]),
  233:     compile:file(filename:join(Dir, File), [return | Opts]).
  234: 
  235: 
  236: %% ===========================================================================
  237: 
  238: %% Ensure a Grouped AVP is represented by a list in the avps field.
  239: success() ->
  240:     Avps = [{295, <<1:32>>},  %% Termination-Cause
  241:             {284, [{280, "Proxy-Host"}, %% Proxy-Info
  242:                    {33, "Proxy-State"}, %%
  243:                    {295, <<2:32>>}]}],  %% Termination-Cause
  244:     #diameter_packet{avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 295,
  245:                                            value = 1,
  246:                                            data = <<1:32>>},
  247:                              [#diameter_avp{code = 284},
  248:                               #diameter_avp{code = 280},
  249:                               #diameter_avp{code = 33},
  250:                               #diameter_avp{code = 295,
  251:                                             value = 2,
  252:                                             data = <<2:32>>}]],
  253:                      errors = []}
  254:         = str(repkg(str(Avps))).
  255: 
  256: %% ===========================================================================
  257: 
  258: %% Ensure a Grouped AVP is represented by a list in the avps field
  259: %% even in the case of a decode error on a component AVP.
  260: grouped_error() ->
  261:     Avps = [{295, <<1:32>>},  %% Termination-Cause
  262:             {284, [{295, <<0:32>>},      %% Proxy-Info, Termination-Cause
  263:                    {280, "Proxy-Host"},
  264:                    {33, "Proxy-State"}]}],
  265:     #diameter_packet{avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 295,
  266:                                            value = 1,
  267:                                            data = <<1:32>>},
  268:                              [#diameter_avp{code = 284},
  269:                               #diameter_avp{code = 295,
  270:                                             value = undefined,
  271:                                             data = <<0:32>>},
  272:                               #diameter_avp{code = 280},
  273:                               #diameter_avp{code = 33}]],
  274:                      errors = [{5004, #diameter_avp{code = 284}}]}
  275:         = str(repkg(str(Avps))).
  276: 
  277: %% ===========================================================================
  278: 
  279: %% Ensure that a failed decode in Failed-AVP is acceptable, and that
  280: %% the component AVPs are decoded if possible.
  281: failed_error() ->
  282:     Avps = [{279, [{295, <<0:32>>},    %% Failed-AVP, Termination-Cause
  283:                    {258, <<1:32>>},             %% Auth-Application-Id
  284:                    {284, [{280, "Proxy-Host"},  %% Proxy-Info
  285:                           {33, "Proxy-State"},
  286:                           {295, <<0:32>>},      %% Termination-Cause, invalid
  287:                           {258, <<2:32>>}]}]}], %% Auth-Application-Id
  288:     #diameter_packet{avps = [[#diameter_avp{code = 279},
  289:                               #diameter_avp{code = 295,
  290:                                             value = undefined,
  291:                                             data = <<0:32>>},
  292:                               #diameter_avp{code = 258,
  293:                                             value = 1,
  294:                                             data = <<1:32>>},
  295:                               [#diameter_avp{code = 284},
  296:                                #diameter_avp{code = 280},
  297:                                #diameter_avp{code = 33},
  298:                                #diameter_avp{code = 295,
  299:                                              value = undefined},
  300:                                #diameter_avp{code = 258,
  301:                                              value = 2,
  302:                                              data = <<2:32>>}]]],
  303:                      errors = []}
  304:         = sta(repkg(sta(Avps))).
  305: 
  306: %% ===========================================================================
  307: 
  308: %% str/1
  309: 
  310: str(#diameter_packet{avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 263},
  311:                              #diameter_avp{code = 264},
  312:                              #diameter_avp{code = 296},
  313:                              #diameter_avp{code = 283},
  314:                              #diameter_avp{code = 258,
  315:                                            value = 0}
  316:                              | T]}
  317:     = Pkt) ->
  318:     Pkt#diameter_packet{avps = T};
  319: 
  320: str(Avps) ->
  321:     OH = "diameter.erlang.org",
  322:     OR = "erlang.org",
  323:     DR = "example.com",
  324:     Sid = "diameter.erlang.org;123;456",
  325: 
  326:     [#diameter_header{version = 1,
  327:                       cmd_code = 275,  %% STR
  328:                       is_request = true,
  329:                       application_id = 0,
  330:                       hop_by_hop_id = 17,
  331:                       end_to_end_id = 42,
  332:                       is_proxiable = false,
  333:                       is_error = false,
  334:                       is_retransmitted = false}
  335:      | avp([{263, Sid},  %% Session-Id
  336:             {264, OH},   %% Origin-Host
  337:             {296, OR},   %% Origin-Realm
  338:             {283, DR},   %% Destination-Realm
  339:             {258, <<0:32>>}]  %% Auth-Application-Id
  340:            ++ Avps)].
  341: 
  342: %% sta/1
  343: 
  344: sta(#diameter_packet{avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 263},
  345:                              #diameter_avp{code = 268},
  346:                              #diameter_avp{code = 264},
  347:                              #diameter_avp{code = 296},
  348:                              #diameter_avp{code = 278,
  349:                                            value = 4}
  350:                              | T]}
  351:     = Pkt) ->
  352:     Pkt#diameter_packet{avps = T};
  353: 
  354: sta(Avps) ->
  355:     OH = "diameter.erlang.org",
  356:     OR = "erlang.org",
  357:     Sid = "diameter.erlang.org;123;456",
  358: 
  359:     [#diameter_header{version = 1,
  360:                       cmd_code = 275,  %% STA
  361:                       is_request = false,
  362:                       application_id = 0,
  363:                       hop_by_hop_id = 17,
  364:                       end_to_end_id = 42,
  365:                       is_proxiable = false,
  366:                       is_error = false,
  367:                       is_retransmitted = false}
  368:      | avp([{263, Sid},         %% Session-Id
  369:             {268, <<2002:32>>}, %% Result-Code
  370:             {264, OH},          %% Origin-Host
  371:             {296, OR},          %% Origin-Realm
  372:             {278, <<4:32>>}]    %% Origin-State-Id
  373:            ++ Avps)].
  374: 
  375: avp({Code, Data}) ->
  376:     #diameter_avp{code = Code,
  377:                   data = avp(Data)};
  378: 
  379: avp(#diameter_avp{} = A) ->
  380:     A;
  381: 
  382: avp([{_,_} | _] = Avps) ->
  383:     lists:map(fun avp/1, Avps);
  384: 
  385: avp(V) ->
  386:     V.
  387: 
  388: %% repkg/1
  389: 
  390: repkg(Msg) ->
  391:     recode(Msg, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733).
  392: 
  393: recode(#diameter_packet{} = Pkt, Dict) ->
  394:     diameter_codec:decode(Dict, opts(Dict), diameter_codec:encode(Dict, Pkt));
  395: 
  396: recode(Msg, Dict) ->
  397:     recode(#diameter_packet{msg = Msg}, Dict).
  398: 
  399: opts(Mod) ->
  400:     #{app_dictionary => Mod,
  401:       decode_format => record,
  402:       string_decode => false,
  403:       strict_mbit => true,
  404:       rfc => 6733,
  405:       failed_avp => false}.
